intro: Stevia paniculigera, commonly known as the sweetleaf plant, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant is known for its high concentration of steviol glycosides, which are naturally occurring sweeteners. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its medicinal and culinary uses, it has gained interest in both traditional and modern herbal practices.
